applicationType.cantSelectTableDescription: The database couldn't be selected because it doesn't have any tables. Use the sidebar to create one.

error.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid e-mail address.
error.notMatchingPassword: This field must match your password field.
error.minLength: A minimum of {min} characters is required here.
error.maxLength: A maximum of {max} characters is allowed here.
error.minMaxLength: A minimum of {min} and a maximum of {max} characters is allowed here.

permission.adminDescription: Can fully configure and edit groups and applications.
permission.memberDescription: Can fully configure and edit applications.

fieldDocs.readOnly: This is a read only field.
fieldDocs.linkRow: Accepts an array containing the identifiers of the related rows from table id {table}. All identifiers must be provided every time the relations are updated. If an empty array is provided all relations will be deleted.
fieldDocs.decimal: Accepts a decimal with {places} decimal places after the dot.
fieldDocs.decimalPositive: Accepts a positive decimal with {places} decimal places after the dot.
fieldDocs.date: Accepts a date time in ISO format.
fieldDocs.dateTime: Accepts a date in ISO format.
fieldDocs.dateResponse: The response will be a datetime in ISO format.
fieldDocs.dateTimeResponse: The response will be a date in ISO format.
fieldDocs.lastModifiedReadOnly: The last modified field is a read only field.
fieldDocs.createdOnReadOnly: The created on field is a read only field.
fieldDocs.url: Accepts a string that must be a URL.
fieldDocs.email: Accepts a string that must be an email address.
fieldDocs.file: Accepts an array of objects containing at least the name of the user file. You can use the "File uploads" endpoints to upload the file. The response of those calls can be provided directly as object here. The endpoints can be found in the left sidebar.
fieldDocs.singleSelect: Accepts an integer representing the chosen select option id or null if none is selected.
fieldDocs.multipleSelect: Accepts an array of integers each representing the chosen select option id.
fieldDocs.phoneNumber: Accepts a phone number which has a maximum length of 100 characters consisting solely of digits, spaces and the following characters: Nx,._+*()#=;/- .
fieldDocs.formula: A read-only field defined by a formula written in the Baserow formula language.
fieldDocs.lookup: A read-only field connected to a link row field which returns an array of values and row ids from the chosen lookup field in the linked table.
fieldDocs.multipleCollaborators: Accepts an array of objects where each object contains a user's id.

form.invalidURLDescription: The webhook URL is invalid, inaccessible or prohibited.

clientHandler.notFoundDescription: The selected {name} wasn't found, maybe it has already been deleted.
clientHandler.networkErrorDescription: Could not connect to the API server.
clientHandler.tooManyRequestsDescription: You are sending too many requests to the server. Please wait a moment.
clientHandler.notCompletedDescription: The action couldn't be completed because an unknown error has occurred.
clientHandler.userNotInGroupDescription: The action couldn't be completed because you aren't a member of the related group.
clientHandler.invalidGroupPermissionsDescription: The action couldn't be completed because you don't have the right permissions to the related group.
clientHandler.tableDoesNotExistDescription: The action couldn't be completed because the related table doesn't exist anymore.
clientHandler.rowDoesNotExistDescription: The action couldn't be completed because the related row doesn't exist anymore.
clientHandler.fileSizeTooLargeDescription: The provided file is too large.
clientHandler.invalidFileDescription: The provided file is not a valid file.
clientHandler.fileUrlCouldNotBeReachedDescription: The provided file URL could not be reached.
clientHandler.invalidFileUrlDescription: The provided file URL is invalid or not allowed.
clientHandler.adminCannotDeactivateSelfDescription: You cannot de-activate or un-staff yourself.
clientHandler.maxFieldCountExceededDescription: The action couldn't be completed because the field count exceeds the limit
clientHandler.cannotRestoreParentBeforeChildDescriptio: You cannot restore this item because it depends on a deleted item. Please restore the parent item first.
clientHandler.cannotRestoreAsRelatedTableTrashedTitle: Please restore the related tables first.
clientHandler.cannotRestoreAsRelatedTableTrashedDescri: You cannot restore this field because it depends on other tables which are still trashed. Please restore the other related tables first.
clientHandler.groupUserIsLastAdminDescription: It's not possible to leave the group because you're the last admin or because other admin's accounts are pending deletion. Please delete the group or give another user admin permissions.
clientHandler.errorMaxJobCountExceededDescription: You cannot start any more of these actions as you have others still running in the background. Please try again once the previous actions complete.
clientHandler.failedToLockFieldDueToConflictDescriptio: Another operation is currently updating or using this field, please wait until it finishes before trying again.
clientHandler.failedToLockTableDueToConflictDescriptio: Another operation is currently updating or using this table, please wait until it finishes before trying again.
clientHandler.failedToUndoRedoDueToConflictDescription: Another operation is currently running blocking your undo or redo, please wait until it finishes before trying again.
clientHandler.maximumSnapshotsReachedDescription: The maximum number of snapshots in a group has been reached.
clientHandler.snapshotBeingCreatedTitle: A snapshot is already being created
clientHandler.snapshotBeingCreatedDescription: It is not possible to create multiple snapshots at the same time.
clientHandler.snapshotBeingRestoredDescription: It is not possible to use snapshots that are currently being restored.
clientHandler.snapshotBeingDeletedDescription: It is not possible to use snapshots that are currently being deleted.
clientHandler.snapshotNameNotUniqueTitle: The snapshot name has to be unique.
clientHandler.snapshotNameNotUniqueDescription: All snapshot names have to be unique per application.
clientHandler.snapshotOperationLimitExceededDescriptio: You have reached a limit on the number of running snapshot operations. Please wait until previous operation finishes.

apiDocs.uploadFileDescription: The `file` multipart containing the file contents.
apiDocs.uploadFileViaUrlDescription: Uploads a file to Baserow by downloading it from the provided URL.
apiDocs.userFieldNamesDescription:
When any value is provided for the `user_field_names` GET param then field names returned by this endpoint will be the actual names of the fields.

 If the `user_field_names` GET param is not provided, then all returned field names will be `field_` followed by the id of the field. For example `field_1` refers to the field with an id of `1`.

formulaFunctions.upperDescription: Returns its argument in upper case.
formulaFunctions.lowerDescription: Returns its argument in lower case.
formulaFunctions.concatDescription: Returns its arguments joined together as a single piece of text.
formulaFunctions.addDescription: Returns its two arguments added together.
formulaFunctions.multiplyDescription: Returns its two arguments multiplied together.
formulaFunctions.divideDescription: Returns its two arguments divided, the first divided by the second.
formulaFunctions.equalDescription: Returns if its two arguments have the same value.
formulaFunctions.ifDescription: If the first argument is true then returns the second argument, otherwise returns the third.
formulaFunctions.datetimeFormatDescription: Converts the date to text given a way of formatting the date.
formulaFunctions.toNumberDescription: Converts the input to a number if possible.
formulaFunctions.fieldDescription: Returns the field named by the single text argument.
formulaFunctions.lookupDescription: Looks up the values from a field in another table for rows in a link row field. The first argument should be the name of a link row field in the current table and the second should be the name of a field in the linked table.
formulaFunctions.isBlankDescription: Returns true if the argument is empty or blank, false otherwise.
formulaFunctions.tDescription: Returns the arguments value if it is text, but otherwise ''.
formulaFunctions.notDescription: Returns false if the argument is true and true if the argument is false.
formulaFunctions.greaterThanDescription: Returns true if the first argument greater than the second, otherwise false.
formulaFunctions.greaterThanOrEqualDescription: Returns true if the first argument is greater than or equal to the second, otherwise false.
formulaFunctions.lessThanDescription: Returns true if the first argument less than the second, otherwise false.
formulaFunctions.lessThanOrEqualDescription: Returns true if the first argument less than or equal to the second, otherwise false.
formulaFunctions.toDateDescription: Returns the first argument converted into a date given a date format string as the second argument.
formulaFunctions.dayDescription: Returns the day of the month as a number between 1 to 31 from the argument.
formulaFunctions.dateDiffDescription: Given a date unit to measure in as the first argument ('year', 'month', 'week', 'day', 'hour', 'minute', 'seconds') calculates and returns the number of units from the second argument to the third.
formulaFunctions.andDescription: Returns the logical and of the first and second argument, so if they are both true then the result is true, otherwise it is false.
formulaFunctions.orDescription: Returns the logical or of the first and second argument, so if either are true then the result is true, otherwise it is false.
formulaFunctions.dateIntervalDescription: Returns the date interval corresponding to the provided argument.
formulaFunctions.replaceDescription: Replaces all instances of the second argument in the first argument with the third argument.
formulaFunctions.searchDescription: Returns a positive integer starting from 1 for the first occurrence of the second argument inside the first, or 0 if no occurrence is found.
formulaFunctions.rowIdDescription: Returns the rows unique identifying number.
formulaFunctions.lengthDescription: Returns the number of characters in the first argument provided.
formulaFunctions.reverseDescription: Returns the reversed text of the provided first argument.
formulaFunctions.notEqualDescription: Returns if its two arguments have different values.
formulaFunctions.countDescription: Returns the number of items in its first argument.
formulaFunctions.containsDescription: Returns true if the first piece of text contains at least once the second.
formulaFunctions.leftDescription: Extracts the left most characters from the first input, stops when it has extracted the number of characters specified by the second input.
formulaFunctions.rightDescription: Extracts the right most characters from the first input, stops when it has extracted the number of characters specified by the second input.
formulaFunctions.trimDescription: Removes all whitespace from the left and right sides of the input.
formulaFunctions.regexReplaceDescription: Replaces any text in the first input which matches the regex specified by the second input with the text in the third input.
formulaFunctions.greatestDescription: Returns the greatest value of the two inputs.
formulaFunctions.leastDescription: Returns the smallest of the two inputs.
formulaFunctions.monthDescription: Returns the number of months in the provided date.
formulaFunctions.yearDescription: Returns the number of years in the provided date.
formulaFunctions.secondDescription: Returns the number of seconds in the provided date.
formulaFunctions.whenEmptyDescription: If the first input is calculated to be empty the second input will be returned instead, otherwise if the first input is not empty the first will be returned.
formulaFunctions.anyDescription: Returns true if any one of the provided looked up values is true, false if they are all false.
formulaFunctions.everyDescription: Returns true if every one of the provided looked up values is true, false otherwise.
formulaFunctions.maxDescription: Returns the largest number from all the looked up values provided.
formulaFunctions.minDescription: Returns the smallest number from all the looked up values provided.
formulaFunctions.joinDescription: Concats all of the values from the first input together using the values from the second input.
formulaFunctions.stddevPopDescription: Calculates the population standard deviation of the values and returns the result. The population standard deviation should be used when the provided values contain a  value for every single piece of data in the population.
formulaFunctions.stddevSampleDescription: Calculates the sample standard deviation of the values and returns the result. The sample deviation should be used when the provided values are only for a sample or subset  of values for an underlying population.
formulaFunctions.varianceSampleDescription: Calculates the sample variance of the values and returns the result. The sample variance should be used when the provided values are only for a sample or subset of values for an underlying population.
formulaFunctions.variancePopDescription: Calculates the population variance of the values and returns the result. The population variance should be used when the provided values contain a  value for every single piece of data in the population.
formulaFunctions.avgDescription: Averages all of the values and returns the result.
formulaFunctions.sumDescription: Sums all of the values and returns the result.
formulaFunctions.filterDescription: Filters down an expression involving a lookup/link field reference or a lookup function call.
formulaFunctions.linkDescription: Creates a hyperlink using the URI provided in the first argument.
formulaFunctions.buttonDescription: Creates a button using the URI (first argument) and label (second argument).
formulaFunctions.getLinkLabelDescription: Gets the label from a formula using the link or button functions.
formulaFunctions.getLinkUrlDescription: Gets the url from a formula using the link or button functions.
formulaFunctions.roundDescription: Returns first argument rounded to the number of digits specified by the second argument.
formulaFunctions.truncDescription: Returns only the first argument converted into an integer by truncating any decimal places.

urlCheck.invalidUrlEnvVarDescription: The {name} environment variable has been set to an invalid value. Your site admin must change {name} to a valid URL starting with http:// or https:// and then restart Baserow to fix this error.
